lenders.name: Cory
lenders.loan_because: it's what Jesus taught me to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student at Spring Arbor University. My major is mathematics.

lenders.name: Tammy
lenders.loan_because: I like to help people.

lenders.name: Stefan
lenders.loan_because: To whom much has been given, much has been required.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell books on the internet.

lenders.name: Katarina
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference. My parents were able to suceed in the US because someone believed in them and gave them a loan to buy real estate because no one would rent to a family of 11. They were able to repay all their debt in a few years and are now living the American dream!
lenders.occupational_info: I act as an advisor for a specific business line within a US bank.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: I love the idea of microfinance.  It is something that I can do to make my world a better place.  I believe I was very blessed to be born into the circumstances that I have and want to share them with others who are less fortunate.  When we enrich the lives of those around us or even across the globe the world becomes a better place, a place of love, a place of compassion, a place of hope, a place of positive energy and spirit.  It gives me great satisfaction to be a part of such an endeavor.
lenders.occupational_info: I recently graduated as a Family Nurse Practitioner after many years of struggle and work.  I understand how hard it is to come up with the money to accomplish a goal.  Where I live it is possible with hard work and determination to accomplish a goal.  I want to give others the opportunity to do that as well.  I love serving others and helping them to find peace in a world where little is offered elsewhere.  I treat their physical symptoms as well as their emotional, spiritual, and mental symptoms to help them to find this peace.  A smile and a word from someone who cares can make all the difference in someone's day.

lenders.name: Rob & Lisa
lenders.loan_because: We want to help.
lenders.occupational_info: We are currently college students, but we will be graduating soon.

lenders.name: Kim & Molly
lenders.loan_because: It's a great thing to do and so many need a helping hand.
lenders.occupational_info: We have a Christmas tree farm and a big garden that we grow many vegetables.

lenders.name: Rheana
lenders.loan_because: I believe in karma.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a first-year medical student. I look forward to living life as a physician and providing healthcare to people globally.

lenders.name: Georgiana
lenders.loan_because: I love all the great ideas people have to start wonderful new businesses and want to be a part of it!

lenders.name: IN MEMORY OF PER IMSLAND
lenders.occupation: IN MEMORY OF MY FATHER PER IMSLAND
lenders.loan_because:
IN MEMORY OF PER IMSLAND



This account is established in memory of my father, Per Imsland, born June 1931 and died April 2008 in Stavanger, Norway.

My father was born in Stavanger on June 12, 1931, the only child of Nacor and Aslaug Imsland. At an early age he began working in his father’s butcher shop, where he continued working during his Engineering studies at Kongsgaard College in Stavanger. Early on he showed his great entrepreneurship, and in the course of his life he helped start many businesses, and also had his own business. He married my mother, Haldis Espedal, in 1956. I was born in 1958 and my brother in 1963. He always encouraged my brother and me to do our best and see the opportunities that lay in front of us. Because of him and my mother, my brother and I have our own businesses today and are doing well because of what they taught us.

I want his spirit of giving and encouragement to go on living through this KIVA account, helping other people who are not as fortunate as us, making it possible for them to start and continue having a business that takes care of them and their families.

Sissel Imsland Bridges
Michigan, USA.
Sissely@aol.com

lenders.name: Bunny
lenders.loan_because: I respect the entrepreneurs who work so hard to make a living. A little of my money can make a much bigger difference in another country than it can where I live.

lenders.name: Kyle
lenders.loan_because: I heard about Kiva through Bill Clinton's book Giving: How Each of Us Can Change the World.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a cell biologist at the University of Texas at Dallas, School of Behavioral and Brain Sciences.

lenders.name: Tanya
lenders.loan_because: now I can-- it's accessible, easy, and I can see how my  small loan (combined with others) are helping to change lives. Microlending is an amazing way to give the power and freedom back to people instead of initiating top-down oppressive approaches that leave the deicion-making to westerners.
lenders.occupational_info: I help working people achieve their dreams here in America. When people unite, they have power-- just like the microloans help a group of people achieve their dreams- the labor union helps working people receive a fair wage and the respect that each human deserves in the workplace.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: it's a great way to become a better steward of what God's given me, and a way to be a partner of what He is doing all over the world. Rather cool, don't you think?

lenders.occupational_info: i try to live as simply as I can, scavenge and repair and recycle tools, machinery,etc.

lenders.name: Barbara
lenders.loan_because: I love to see how the money multiplies itself, so I can lend to more and more people...my original deposit has morphed into 10 times as much in loans over the years!  Now, THAT'S recycling... ;-)
lenders.occupational_info: A bit of a "mad scientist"...I make special custom medications "from scratch", in situations where mass-manufactured drugs are inappropriate (eg: making a heart medicine tablet into a flavored liquid for a baby, or making a medicine into a gel which can be rubbed on the skin instead of swallowed...).

lenders.loan_because: I want to remove the poverty wall one brick at a time.

lenders.occupational_info: I am murugan,23, a graduate in engineering and social work,excutive member of  an NGO Regency for Innovative Social Change in India based at Dindigul,Tamilnadu,India and social innovator.

lenders.occupational_info: I am China's CPA and US CPA candidate, before I left my job I work as Sarbanes Oxley consultant. So I  will be your ambassador to the poor place and validate the business plan for your money and your love for less fortunated people.

Also, Jesus probably likes it...

And you’re not just giving them money to get them through one more day. You’re helping them to help themselves to better lives. Repayment of the loans gives them the opportunity to become a part of the cycle of helping others.

lenders.name: Amanda
lenders.loan_because: it is the right thing to do – I believe we are duty-bound to help those who are less fortunate.  Also, as Kiva says, because these are loans rather than donations, we are able to help to make real differences in people’s lives half way across the world without costing us anything.  I think Kiva is a great example of how not-for-profits can leverage today’s technology to connect lenders with borrowers around the world.

lenders.occupational_info: I sail as a chief mate on a merchant ship, carrying all types of containerized goods from the west coast of the U.S. to Hawaii and sometimes to Guam and China as well. I'm  responsible for the maintenance of the hull, deck and cargo holds. I oversee the loading of cargo in order to ensure the vessel's stability and that the cargo is properly segregated and secured. I ensure all crew are properly trained by planning and running weekly drills. It's a demanding position, sometimes satisfying, sometimes frustrating, always challenging.

lenders.name: Jay
lenders.loan_because: I believe micro-lending can be an incredible tool for lifting people out of poverty.  Micro-lending is not new.  It's been happening for decades and the concept is proven.  It really works.
lenders.occupational_info:
Marketing Professional with 1.5 decades of experience in strategic direct marketing.

I view marketing as more science than art. I'm far more interested in direct response marketing than in branding. I employ a methodical, disciplined approach that is always driven by the bottom line.

It starts with an idea - driven by strategic company needs. I believe in testing ideas at the smallest feasible scale, followed by careful measurement. Test, measure, refine, scale, repeat.

Over the last 5 years, I've gravitated to web marketing. Search marketing has become, by far, the most cost-effective advertising channel in the history of the planet. From a marketer's perspective it's the holy grail because your market self-identifies. It's a dream come true when your market tells you (by the keywords they search for) that they are looking for what you are selling.

For more on my marketing philosophy and experience, visit http://www.jaycasper.net.

Some websites I have worked on:

	
http://www.jaycasper.net
http://www.heritage-education.com
http://www.uscareerinstitute.com
http://www.mckinleycollege.com
http://www.slopetracker.com
http://www.golftrackergps.com
http://www.denverpsychologist.com
http://www.fineprintimaging.com
